comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Lucan Station Signal Box on old OSI map maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,703110,732793,7,9 The track diagram shows the next section, Clondalkin. No trace of Lucan Station on Google maps There might not have been mains electricity in the isolated signal box, only the electric telegraph instruments.

comment._content: Must be casual Friday, the collar is undone with no tie!

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: Yes very little left of Lucan South, apart from one of the platform walls on the Down side. Through the window you can see the Baldonnell Siding, laid in 1918 to connect with a narrow gauge line to the nearby aerodrome during its construction. The siding remained long after, and was only removed when the cabin was closed and demolished in 1973.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/flyingsnail] Bit of an oddity, but the roundabout at Baldonnel looks like an RAF roundel from the air. maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,703960,728494,7,0 Here it is on Google Street View
